page.title: 08SARRATT J.M.I. SCHOOL
page.content: {Sarratt School}has existed for over 100 years. The original, all age, C of E school was housed in a building in Church Lane. The number on role rose to 196 in 1976 with a staff of 11.From the 1960s a building was constructed on a site behind the village pond.7 years ago the original building was sold as a private house and a fully serviced, two classroom unit was erected on the new site. Children travel to school by coach from the outlying hamlets as well as walking and being ferried from all parts of the village. The role at present fluctuates between 85 and 95 and the total staff numbers 6.Smaller families, expensive private housing in this 'Greenbelt' village and local authority housing occupied by older tenants have caused this decline.
